The five drawbacks of overstaying [an5.2: You have a lot of stuff and store it up.
You have a lot of medicine and store it up.
You have a lot of duties and responsibilities, and become capable in whatever needs to be done.
You mix closely with laypeople and renunciates, socializing inappropriately like a layperson.
When you leave that monastery, you miss it.
The five benefits of staying for a reaso: You don’t have a lot of stuff and store it up.
You don’t have a lot of medicine and store it up.
You don’t have a lot of duties and responsibilities, or become capable in whatever needs to be done.
You don’t mix closely with laypeople and renunciates, socializing inappropriately like a layperson.
When you leave that monastery, you don’t miss it.
